issue.title: Cached models lose server and name information

content.raw: Following up with the version number. Assuming a server works with version 1, and eventually we release a version 2 API and the server adopts it. Should we store a different copy of the models downloaded using version 2? I see the version number as the language spoken between server and client but not affecting the models. What I believe it should change is the version number used in our configuration file. We should bump that version to `2.0`, and then, all requests (including `UniqueName()`) should use it. Maybe there are subtle details that we'll show up when implementing it but in theory I'd say that the version should be outside. In any case, I also don't have a strong opinion against it, if makes things easier.
content.html: Following up with the version number. Assuming a server works with version 1, and eventually we release a version 2 API and the server adopts it. Should we store a different copy of the models downloaded using version 2? I see the version number as the language spoken between server and client but not affecting the models. What I believe it should change is the version number used in our configuration file. We should bump that version to 2.0, and then, all requests (including UniqueName()) should use it. Maybe there are subtle details that we'll show up when implementing it but in theory I'd say that the version should be outside. In any case, I also don't have a strong opinion against it, if makes things easier.
